headline: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: Powered Down
summary: JPMorgan gave a bum start to bank earnings. The Dow industrials component slid 4.2% after results showed a surprise slip in investment-banking fees and a significant charge for taking over the Apple credit-card program.

content.title: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: Powered Down
content.summary: JPMorgan gave a bum start to bank earnings. The Dow industrials component slid 4.2% after results showed a surprise slip in investment-banking fees and a significant charge for taking over the Apple credit-card program.

headline: How Meta's Latest Job Cuts Compare to Recent Broader Tech Sector Layoffs
summary: The roughly 1,000 job cuts in Reality Labs come as Meta reallocates resources from the metaverse to AI wearables and mobile products.

content.title: How Meta's Latest Job Cuts Compare to Recent Broader Tech Sector Layoffs

headline: Meta is a 'hated' name right now, but this analyst is still bullish
summary: Meta's (META) artificial intelligence (AI) efforts are in focus after the company hired President Trump's former security adviser, Dina Powell McCormick, as its new president and vice chair. Meta also announced a new AI compute initiative. Jefferies senior analyst Brent Thill joins Market Domination Overtime with Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma to dive deeper into Meta's AI plans. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

content.title: Meta is a 'hated' name right now, but this analyst is still bullish
content.description:
Meta's (META) artificial intelligence (AI) efforts are in focus after the company hired President Trump's former security adviser, Dina Powell McCormick, as its new president and vice chair. Meta also announced a new AI compute initiative.

Jefferies senior analyst Brent Thill joins Market Domination Overtime with Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma to dive deeper into Meta's AI plans.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Warby Parker (WRBY) Soars 9.4% on Strong AI Glasses Demand
summary: We recently published 10 Stocks Leaving Wall Street in the Dust; 4 Hit Fresh Records. Warby Parker Inc. (NYSE:WRBY) was one of the top performers on Tuesday. Warby Parker bounced back by 9.44 percent on Tuesday to close at $29.09 apiece, as news of strong demand for artificial intelligence glasses spilled over to its stock. […]

headline: Belgian cybersecurity startup Aikido hits unicorn status with new funding round
summary: STOCKHOLM, Jan 14 - Belgium's Aikido Security has raised $60 million from investors led ​by tech-focused private equity firm DST Global ‌at a valuation of $1 billion, the cybersecurity startup said on ‌Wednesday, making it among Europe's first new unicorns of 2026. Founded in 2022, Aikido's security software helps developers detect and address risk automatically. It counts mobile app ⁠and game developer ‌Niantic, fintech Revolut and music streaming platform SoundCloud among its customers.

content.title: Belgian cybersecurity startup Aikido hits unicorn status with new funding round
content.summary: STOCKHOLM, Jan 14 - Belgium's Aikido Security has raised $60 million from investors led ​by tech-focused private equity firm DST Global ‌at a valuation of $1 billion, the cybersecurity startup said on ‌Wednesday, making it among Europe's first new unicorns of 2026. Founded in 2022, Aikido's security software helps developers detect and address risk automatically. It counts mobile app ⁠and game developer ‌Niantic, fintech Revolut and music streaming platform SoundCloud among its customers.

headline: Assessing EssilorLuxottica (ENXTPA:EL) Valuation As AI Smart Glasses Capacity May Double
summary: Reports that EssilorLuxottica Société anonyme (ENXTPA:EL) and Meta may double AI smart glasses production to 20 million units, with capacity potentially above 30 million, put fresh attention on how this segment could influence the eyewear group’s investment case. See our latest analysis for EssilorLuxottica Société anonyme. The AI smart glasses headlines focus on a stock that has already experienced a steady backdrop, with the latest share price at €278.0 and a year-to-date share price return...

headline: Hazeltree 2025 Year-in-Review Finds Hedge Fund Crowding Diverged Sharply by Region
summary: NEW YORK & LONDON, January 14, 2026--Hedge fund crowdedness in 2025 diverged sharply by region, reflecting fundamentally different economic drivers across North America, EMEA, and APAC, according to Hazeltree, a leading provider of integrated treasury and liquidity management solutions for alternative asset managers.

content.title: Hazeltree 2025 Year-in-Review Finds Hedge Fund Crowding Diverged Sharply by Region

headline: The ‘Magnificent 7’ stocks are dying, and Wall Street is pretty happy about it
summary: But the dominance of the Mag 7 is likely to come to an end this year, many on Wall Street believe—if only because their valuations can’t exponentially go up forever.

headline: CoreWeave CEO Calls Nvidia Circular Financing Claims 'Ridiculous,' Says Stake Too Small To Prop Up $42 Billion Company
summary: CoreWeave Inc. (NASDAQ:CRWV) CEO Michael Intrator has forcefully rejected allegations that his company is engaged in “circular financing” with Nvidia Corp.(NASDAQ:NVDA), describing the narrative as “ridiculous” and mathematically unsound. ‘Ridiculous’ Narrative In a recent appearance on the Big Technology Podcast, Intrator argued that Nvidia's minority stake in the specialized cloud provider is “de minimis” compared to CoreWeave’s massive capital scale, dismissing the concerns as a distraction a
